conclusion: Identify the given values: Mass of slider A and B, angle, coefficient of kinetic friction, gravitational acceleration.
Calculate the frictional force on each slider using the formula for frictional force.
Since both sliders are just on the verge of not sliding upwards, the sum of the frictional forces equals the external force F.
Substitute the frictional forces into the equation for the external force F.
Simplify the equation for the external force F.
Solve for F using the simplified equation.
Calculate the magnitude of the external force F.
The magnitude of the external force F is 3.4 N.
